Danganronpa: Despair's Horizon
‚ôß ‚îÄ ‚ùÄ„ÄéDorms (KG)„Äè‚ùÄ ‚îÄ ‚ôß / house-of-nature
Residents: John, Aria, Maximina, Akuza, Sadao
Monokuma | Kev 2021-11-23 22:05:15Z
The house of nature. Surrounded by greenery, moss, and rolling hills, this feature of the island blends right into the landscape. The path leading up to the house winds and curves around the moss, resembling the patterns of the earth. Trees and outshoots of grass grow throughout the area. The house itself is built of clay and sand bricks, also known as adobe bricks. Different compositions of adobe bricks have been used to create frames for the windows. On top of that, a wooden frame was also used in the creation of this house. The windows are screens made of leaves. Overall, the whole house seems to have been made by materials from nature. Opening the door, the inside seems to have a similar theme. Desks in here are made from twisted wood native to this area, along with the flooring, bed frames, and other similar objects. The interior seems 18th century Korean in nature, though the minimalistic part of that culture seems to have not been carried over. Shelves of various items significant to gardening and care-taking are in here. Wools rugs cover the floor with tapestries and paintings hung up on the walls. The artworks contain scenes from nature, such as the mountains of Indonesia and the Great American Plains. Notably, a poem seems to have been written on the walls in here. It reads: "Green grass covers the valley, Do you sleep; are you at rest? O where is that lovely face? Can mere bones lie buried here? I have wine, but no chance to share it. Alone, I pour it sadly." A small, empty bottle of alcohol is left by the poem on the wall.
A tree is also seen growing out of a window in this house, tearing through one of the windows. It lets in a bit more light, and you can see a bird's nest just outside the window. Another thing about this tree; there's a small hallow in it. Looking inside, you can see a bit of dirt and something else: a rose. It seems impossible that a rose could grow in a dark and cramped space, but it persists regardless. The rose should be dead by now. Looking at it, the rose looks normal, but one side of the petals of the rose is black, and the other side is white. Strange. "Did you hear about the rose that grew from a crack in the concrete? You wouldn't ask why it had damaged petals, in turn, we would all celebrate its tenacity." Six desks and six beds are also in this house. For the house of nature, the bedframes and desks are made of wood. The desks contain pencils and sheets of paper. There's a small trash can as well. The four beds are evenly spaced throughout the dorm, each bed with its own desk and lamp, as well as wardrobe that holds clothes. Each desk and wardrobe is locked, and must be unlocked with a Monopad. These locks and the locks on the front door are the only semblance of technology in this place. A bathroom is also linked to here, containing a rustic toilet along with a somewhat working shower. The door does lock, and it's supposed to accommodate for all members of this house. Basic amenities are provided for everyone, despite the house being not so modern. For example, a 21st century sink, bath/shower, and toilet are provided with items like soap and toothbrushes. However, items like a hose from the 19th century that they used to wash out bathrooms are here. A razor from the 17th century seems dull and unsafe to use. Overall, you should be able to use the area. (edited)
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/751526893810876497/905749545948938240/IMG_1099.png

Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-04 20:17:20Z
As it is, Aria would most likely choose this place, as it's calm and quiet. Of course, there's the unsettling nature around, but catching the sniffles is better than the intense auras of the other houses, and the uncontrollable noise/activity of the fancy-looking house.
Royalcat08 2021-12-04 20:19:08Z
Sai does make her way here, the bear had mentioned something about dorms and she wanted to take a look around. From what she could tell there didn't seem to be any assigned dorms- which was... nice... but these houses seemed a little worrisome in her own way. She walks into this one and takes a quick look around.... As much as she liked the calm aura of this place it didn't... feel right. Nevermind that they're surrounded by nature and therefore it almost feels a little too beneficial to pick this place but it doesn't suit her. She needed her white walls and cleanliness, or at least something that would make her feel at place. And with that she left.

jozo 2021-12-04 22:06:56Z
"The past has taught me that my words are barely anything. What is strong though, is the ability to adapt. That is what I have learnt from all of my past, and throughout my life. I have also learnt that emotions is what makes and breaks a person. As you could see from my.... behavior back there. I acted to such an extremity because of the memories of my past. I know this sort of scene all too well." He says, sighing and wiping a stray tear. "Oh yes, is there anything to clean my monocle with? Or well, your monocle since you gave me this one. I think something in that cave made it dirty, probably the debris that fell." He sits on the edge of the bed frame, but not before grabbing paper and pencil. "Ah, how I missed writing. I wonder if there are sticky notes here." He feels as if he has forgotten something. Oh! "Oh, how could I forget the most basic of things? Introductions! I am Sadao Matsumoto. Ultimate Poet, and you are?" He says, with his best attempt at a genuine smile, but his dried up tears are still there.

@Jaga Blocks
Aria Karenina BOT 2021-12-23 13:57:21Z
"Eh‚Äî" Whatever Aria may have been doing at the moment was halted abruptly. She turned her head to look at him incredulously for a short second, before breaking contact with a cough. "Right, you're right. It's an official national holiday." It might have been rude to question, seeing that she and Akuza has lived different lives up to this moment. She would be lying if she said she wasn't still curious, however. "It's really close by I think. Maybe that's why the air suddenly got so cold."

@Jaga Blocks

"As for the gift exchange tradition... I don't entirely know myself. It's a common practice that many people do. Showing a bit of gratitude to those you know and love with a heartfelt gift."

Maximina Krolik BOT 2021-12-24 08:58:47Z
Max was up worrying late into the night. Looking at the crude clay rabbit and bitting back memories. Both sting of the past and her uncertain future had her barely able to shut her eyes and as such she decided to pace the room a bit. It was a test of difficultly not to make noise especially in one part of the house that had no rug. Had no rug‚Ä¶ but she could have sworn there was one there before?!? She had spent so many nights before this pacing the rooms in an attempt to ward away her anxious thoughts. But now the familiar floor beneath her was just off slightly. Only now only tonight. With a muffled gasp she realized why it was so odd that only two members of the house of War were at the door. She didn‚Äôt know who but one of them‚Ä¶ they didn‚Äôt find a gem but they took something else. Max had her suspicions considering the looks that lingered past her shoulders from the two at the door. She thought in good faith it might‚Äôve been towards her dorm-mates but they were very well could have been at whoever was in the room with her blind roomies and poor nervous Sadao. That meant that it was much easier to sneak into their dorm than she originally thought‚Ä¶ A righteous fury over took her she began to shiver in anticipation. There would be no sleep for her tonight, only planning, work, anything to get ahead. (edited)
